title: High Forest Rents Contribution
description: In 2021, forest rents accounted for 18.4% of the Solomon Islands' GDP, indicating a significant reliance on forest resources for economic output.

title: Low Female Net Intake Rate in Grade 1
description: In 2018, only 9.5% of the official school-age female population was enrolled in grade 1, highlighting challenges in female primary education access.

title: Low Male Net Intake Rate in Grade 1
description: In 2018, the net intake rate for males in grade 1 was 9.0%, indicating issues in male primary education enrollment.

title: Low Overall Net Intake Rate in Grade 1
description: The overall net intake rate in grade 1 was 9.2% in 2018, reflecting broader challenges in primary education access.

title: Minimal Domestic Private Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, domestic private health expenditure per capita was only $3.65, suggesting limited private investment in health.

title: High Female Employment Rate
description: The employment to population ratio for females aged 15+ was 81.2% in 2024, indicating strong female workforce participation.

title: High Rate of Contributing Family Workers
description: In 2023, 49.3% of the total employment was in contributing family work, suggesting a reliance on informal family labor.

title: High Tariff Rates on Primary Products
description: In 2022, the Solomon Islands applied a weighted mean tariff rate of 48.8% on primary products, indicating high trade protectionism.

title: Dominance of Agricultural Exports
description: In 2018, agricultural raw materials made up 73.3% of merchandise exports, showing a strong dependency on agriculture for trade.
